title: Call Of Duty: Modern Warfare is biggest ever PC install at 175GB
text:
Call Of Duty: Modern Warfare – your hard drive is going to get a bit crowded

You might need to clear out your hard drive if you want to play this year’s COD, as the minimum and recommended specs are revealed.

The one thing you can never complain about with Call Of Duty is a lack of content (well, maybe last year when it didn’t have a story campaign) as it’s always essentially three games in one. But that does have one downside: storing everything on your hard drive.

There’s no information yet on how big the console download will be but the listing on Battle.net has the PC version down as a staggering 175GB.

As far as we know that breaks the record for the biggest PC install ever, ahead of the listing of 150GB for the recently announced Red Dead Redemption II and the 148GB of Final Fantasy XV.

There’s nothing inherently wrong with a game having a large install, assuming the developer isn’t wasting space, as high-resolution textures and assets inevitably require more storage.

But it does create a problem with the increasing popularity of SSDs, which are more expensive than traditional hard drives and so in the next generation may leave many with less space than they’re used to, especially as Sony has not yet said how big the SSD in the PlayStation 5 will be.

Minimum Requirements

Operating System

Windows 7 64-bit (SP1) or Windows 10 64-bit

Processor

Intel Core i3-4340 or AMD FX-6300

Video

NVIDIA GeForce GTX 670 / NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 or AMD Radeon HD 7950 – DirectX 12.0 compatible system

Memory

8 GB RAM

Storage

175 GB available hard drive space

Recommended Specifications

Operating System

Windows 10 64-bit latest update

Processor

Intel Core i5-2500K or AMD Ryzen R5 1600X Processor

Video

NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970/NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1660 or AMD Radeon R9 390 / AMD Radeon RX 580 – DirectX 12.0 compatible system

Memory

12 GB RAM

Storage

175 GB available hard drive space
